channel.title: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help
channel.description:
Hey all,
First time posting and that's because i've been busy attempting to make a [PI] 317 server and I could never get my last server to connect to download my cache from dropbox
So I took the easy way and thought well as a starter try how about I use hamachi....
Well I have hamachi installed and an IP Address ready but how do I connect my IP with the client and source for others to join
Yes I've read the other tutorials and they do not explain it to all extremes
So heres what I've done as a recap Downloaded [PI] Server and Client Installed Hamachi A friend attempted to connect with my hamachi IP but because the server does not have the IP involved in it he was unable to
All help ia accepted and please don't judge that i'm using hamchi I just want to get used to some updating and stuff
Regards Brent
P.S I have skype if you can screenshare what I need to do...

item.title: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

did your portforward right did it say it could see your service on canyouseeme.org?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Brentatechnologies Brentatechnologies
item.description:
@Brentatechnologies wrote:

Alright, So a new problem has occured…that I need some help with
We have portforwarded, and now I need to know how do i make a downloadable cache that is downloaded and unzipped when our downloadable client is being started…

Any solutions?

Read full topic

Brentatechnologies:

Sorry, and thanks I’ll add you when I get some sleep will you be on in say 6 hours?

I don’t know, this should be in a private message. It depends on what I’m going to do today.

item.title: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Brentatechnologies, post:15, topic:428024”]Team, your right, if I can’t do that how could I possibly do the coding?
I’ve done coding, I can practice coding without having to portforward, I don’t know why I can’t but it’s just one of those things.

I’m sorry that I disappoint you to the point where you have to try an lower my spirits. Chaotic thanks I’ll send you them in about 5 hours and if your on we can do then
If not we can do whenever your on
Do you have skype a a just incase?[/quote]

I said I wasn’t trying to discourage you. Add my Skype, I’ll get a friend to help you: SpecialAgentJackBower

Read full topic

If not we can do whenever your on
Do you have skype a a just incase?

item.title: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Brentatechnologies:

Alright so, would anyone be willing to teamview sometime later and give me a hand?

You mean hold your hand? If you can’t do something like this, what makes you think you’ll be able to program a server once you get it up? I don’t mean to discourage you, but think about it. Keep bumping this thread though, I’m sure someone will hold your hand and use T.V.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Chaotic-Madness Chaotic-Madness
item.description:
@Chaotic-Madness wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:9, topic:428024”][quote author=Brentatechnologies link=topic=530717.msg3875988#msg3875988 date=1325685605]
Alright thanks guys and girls??
Now once I’ve portforwarded how do I know it’s worked and can anyone maybe post photos of portforwarding a netgear? I know look in the tutorials but I really prefer having pictures that I know are exactly what I need

Windows 7 also how do I add the port and stuff through firewall
[/quote]

http://www.canyouseeme.org/

I don’t even portforward, but I’m guessing you can just add an exception.[/quote]

http://canyouseeme.org/ isen’t that good really.

Try to just change the client ip and compile after you changed the client ip

Read full topic

item.source: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help

item.title: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“I InDrEk I, post:6, topic:428024”][quote author=Brentatechnologies link=topic=530717.msg3875938#msg3875938 date=1325680829]

Don’t use hamachi

Follow the official tutorial and start over.

I have several times, but, with no luck but now I know I still need no ip for hamachi it’s a bit different I just now need to find whether or not I have to portforward still or just continue as I’m going

Portforwarding Question
You don’t have to be connected directly into the router right? I can host it while being on a wireless connection?
[/quote]You have to login to your router and portforward port 43594 (Look tuts). If you can’t login to your router you could use utorrent to portforward. If doesn’t work you should contact your isp and tell them to portforward.[/quote]

I laughed at the I.S.P. part. Also, if you use UTorrent, expect your server to go down at random times.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help

item.title: [PI] Connecting [PI] to hamachi server - Please Help
item.dc:creator: @I_InDrEk_I I InDrEk I
item.description:
@I_InDrEk_I wrote:

[quote=“Brentatechnologies, post:5, topic:428024”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=530717.msg3875934#msg3875934 date=1325680680]

Don’t use hamachi

Follow the official tutorial and start over.
[/quote]
I have several times, but, with no luck but now I know I still need no ip for hamachi it’s a bit different I just now need to find whether or not I have to portforward still or just continue as I’m going

Portforwarding Question
You don’t have to be connected directly into the router right? I can host it while being on a wireless connection?[/quote]You have to login to your router and portforward port 43594 (Look tuts). If you can’t login to your router you could use utorrent to portforward. If doesn’t work you should contact your isp and tell them to portforward.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Brentatechnologies Brentatechnologies
item.description:
@Brentatechnologies wrote:

Rexxy:

Don’t use the hamachi ip. sign up at no-ip.com and download that client after making a host. then use the ip you made for the server ip.

Does this require portforwarding still? I Got te impression that it didn’t? Mind if I Private message you for more details?

Regards
Brent

Read full topic
